# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
  return dt + Dates.Hour(bump)
end

# This function works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.
# It increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours).
# The function uses the Dates.Hour constructor to add the bump to the DateTime object.
```
